title: Exception when building application with a lot of dependencies, String too large to record error
body:
### Describe the bug

We have application which is using a lot of dependencies. Our GH Action started to fail recently. The error is `String too large to record` coming from https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/blob/main/core/deployment/src/main/java/io/quarkus/deployment/recording/BytecodeRecorderImpl.java#L681

I searched for the commit that triggers this and it's https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/commit/4d053065a5c4a53abf55e1064c1085b8de80b0da to bump GraalVM SDK version to 23.1.2

When I put some logging into `BytecodeRecorderImpl` I realized that when graal sdk 23.0 is used there is no long string coming through `BytecodeRecorderImpl`.
But with graal sdk 23.1 there is long string that represents the classpath.

After some additional digging I found https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/commit/738a24d70ed9e7ec3cdeddc3cb8fb7a2d589b75d (make Truffle from GraalVM 23.1 work) which confirmed that passing of classpath is happening with GraalVM 23.1 (and later).


**Questions:**
So to me this looks like both regression/bug and intentional behavior (fix for issue)
 - Can be the fix for https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/issues/36242 be adjusted (`truffleUsed` logic)?
 - We keep it as is and communicate that Quarkus has limit on classpath length?

CC @geoand @jerboaa

### Expected behavior

### Actual behavior

Error is thrown.

### How to Reproduce?

```
git clone https://github.com/quarkus-qe/beefy-scenarios
cd beefy-scenarios
mvn clean verify -fae -pl 002-quarkus-all-extensions -DskipTests
```
